page.title: 08ROAD TRANSPORT
page.content: The main route in the area studied is the A464(T) from Telford to the West Midlands.There are a number of minor roads crossing the area but the majority of small metalled roads in the area provide access to farms and large houses in the area.The minor roads link the A464 with the villages of Ryton, Albrighton and Tong.The A464 is on the line of a coaching road between London and Holyhead with Whiston Cross in the NW corner being halfway between the two.The A464 exists in its original form apart from a straightening and raising by the Cosford Bridge Pumping Station.This improvement was to lift the road above an area of flooding.The volume of traffic using the road was greatest in 1975 and has substantially reduced with the opening of the M54.Traffic now consists of commuters and lorries.
